Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: IT Saksham Yuva Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Haryana Government is to provide employment opportunities to youths (graduate/post-graduate applicants) from engineering and IT backgrounds who shall undertake the Haryana IT Program (specially designed short-term courses) for the duration of a minimum of 3 months offered.

fields.schemeName: Schemes for welfare of School Children belonging to BPL and BC(A) families: Monthly Stipend for BPL Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to students from BPL students to support their education. Under this scheme, a monthly stipend is provided to students studying in classes 1 to 12 in Haryana Government schools.

fields.schemeName: Punjabi Language Scholarship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: This scheme awards scholarships to students based on their merit in the Punjabi subject in the 8th and 10th class examinations conducted by the Haryana Board of School Education, provided they continue studying the Punjabi subject in the 9th and 11th classes.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME):  Assistance for Saving in Consumption of Energy and Water
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME)" launched by the Industries and Mines Department aims to position Gujarat as a global business hub, promoting sustainable manufacturing, MSME growth, and export competitiveness.

fields.schemeName: The Mizoram Provisional Employees Savings Scheme
fields.briefDescription:
This scheme laid out to allow the members to make defined contribution towards planned savings thereby securing the future in the form of pension. This Scheme shall be compulsory for all Provisional Employees whose
engagement is duly approved by DP&AR and Finance Department, Government of Mizoram.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME):  Assistance for Reimbursement of CGTMSE Fees
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME)" launched by the Industries and Mines Department aims to position Gujarat as a global business hub, promoting sustainable manufacturing, MSME growth, and export competitiveness.

fields.schemeName: Gujarat Textile Policy: Assistance for Saving in Consumption of Energy and Water
fields.briefDescription: The "Gujarat Textile Policy" introduced by the Industries and Mines Department aims to create a vibrant Textile Sector ecosystem and generate enormous employment opportunities in the State.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Benefits Scheme (BBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: "Maternity Benefits Scheme" provides an amount equivalent to 90 days of the minimum wages set by the State Govt. for unskilled workers at the time of childbirth. The applicant should be a female construction worker who has completed one year of membership with the Board.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: ICAR - Post Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribes Candidates
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Post-Matric Scholarship to Scheduled Castes / Scheduled Tribes Candidates" was introduced by ICAR, Dept. of Agricultural Research and Education, to enable the students belonging to the weaker sections of society to complete undergraduate courses.

fields.schemeName: Mukhya Mantri Sarvajan Uchcha Shiksha Chhatravriti Yojana
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims to provide financial assistance to students from all sections of Rajasthan who are pursuing higher education at IITs, IIMs, and other national-level institutions. Under this scheme, 50% of the non-refundable fees are reimbursed to eligible students.

fields.schemeName: Birsa Harit Gram Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Birsa Harit Gram Yojana" by the Rural Development Department, Government of Jharkhand, promotes afforestation while generating sustainable livelihoods. It supports SC, ST, and landless families through plantation activities under MGNREGA, ensuring income and environmental sustainability.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME): Rehabilitation of Sick Enterprises
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME)" launched by the Industries and Mines Department aims to position Gujarat as a global business hub, promoting sustainable manufacturing, MSME growth, and export competitiveness.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME): Assistance in Rent to MSEs
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME)" launched by the Industries and Mines Department aims to position Gujarat as a global business hub, promoting sustainable manufacturing, MSME growth, and export competitiveness.

fields.schemeName: Griha Lakshmi Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Griha Lakshmi" aims to provide financial assistance to women heads of households in Karnataka. The scheme offers a monthly benefit of ₹2,000/- to eligible women, helping them manage household expenses and improve their economic stability.

fields.schemeName: Gujarat Textile Policy: Payroll Assistance
fields.briefDescription: The "Gujarat Textile Policy" introduced by the Industries and Mines Department aims to create a vibrant Textile Sector ecosystem and generate enormous employment opportunities in the State.

fields.schemeName: Gujarat Textile Policy: Interest Subsidy
fields.briefDescription: The "Gujarat Textile Policy" introduced by the Industries and Mines Department aims to create a vibrant Textile Sector ecosystem and generate enormous employment opportunities in the State.

fields.schemeName: Prime Minister Early Career Research Grant
fields.briefDescription: This programme is initiated by the Anusandhan National Research Foundation (ANRF) to assist researchers to initiate their research career in a new institution with a flexible budget and progressive initiatives for ease of doing research.

fields.schemeName: Prime Minister’s Internship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide internship opportunities to one crore youth in top 500 companies in five years. Through this Scheme, youth will gain exposure for 12 months to real-life business environment, across varied professions and employment opportunities.

fields.schemeName: Integrated Horticulture Development Plan Scheme for Scheduled Caste Families
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, Scheduled Caste farmers will be provided with quality planting material and other inputs for mushroom cultivation, bamboo stacking in vegetables, and protected cultivation with a subsidy of up to 90%. Additionally, training will be offered on various aspects of these practices.

fields.schemeName: Gadiya Lohar Maharana Pratap Bhawan Nirman Yojana
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides financial assistance of ₹1,20,000/- in three instalments to Gadiya Lohar families in Rajasthan for the construction of permanent houses and ensuring their settlement.

fields.schemeName: Coaching Help Scheme for JEE-GUJCET-NEET Exams
fields.briefDescription: The "Coaching Help Scheme for JEE-GUJCET-NEET Exams" scheme provides financial assistance to non-reserved category students from the science stream who are getting coaching in institutions with three years or more experience.

fields.schemeName: Uchch Shiksha Puraskar Yojana
fields.briefDescription: "Uchch Shiksha Puraskar Yojana" aims to encourage and motivate students from weaver families to pursue higher education. ₹20,000/- is provided to talented students from weaver families who get admission in first year of Engineering/Medical/CA/MBA courses in any government college in Chhattisgarh.

fields.schemeName: Foreign Education Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Foreign Education Scheme" provides financial assistance for non-reserved category students pursuing higher education abroad after Standard 12.

fields.schemeName: Self-Employment Scheme: Vahan Loan Sahay Yojana
fields.briefDescription: "Vahan Loan Sahay Yojana" is a component under the "Self-Employment Scheme" that provides on-road unit cost to self-employed individuals for purchasing vehicles such as rickshaws, loading rickshaws, Maruti cars, and jeep taxis.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Women and Child Development
fields.schemeName: Women Helpline
fields.briefDescription: Women Helpline provides 24X7 emergency and non-emergency response through telephonic short-code 181 to women

fields.schemeName: Mahila Samridhi Yojana under NSKFDC- Haryana
fields.briefDescription: This scheme offers loans up to ₹1,00,000/- to women Safai Karamcharis or their dependents for economic development through self-employment initiatives, such as establishing cloth shops, dairies, tea shops, bangle shops, beauty parlours, papad making, basketry, tailoring shops, etc.

fields.schemeName: Additional Pension to Widow of Ex-Serviceman having Children
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Sainik and Ardh Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Haryana. Under the scheme, an additional amount, in addition to the pension, is provided to the widow of an ex-serviceman who dies while in service but not in any battle.

fields.schemeName: Union Territory of Lakshadweep Pension Scheme for Old Age
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide monthly financial assistance of ₹1,500/- to senior citizens in the UT. The scheme covers persons above 60 years of age who do not have any source of income.

fields.schemeName: Special Jobs to PwDs - Helper
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, three PwD candidates are employed as Helpers with a monthly salary of ₹9,900/- on an 89-day rotational basis in the District Panchayat offices of their respective islands to address issues related to disabled persons and other associated matters.

fields.schemeName: Family Pension (DBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Family Pension" was launched by the Delhi Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. In this scheme, upon the death of the pensioner, the surviving spouse is provided 50% of the pension amount or ₹1500/-, whichever is higher.

fields.schemeName: Self-Employment Scheme: Nana Vyavasay Mate Loan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: "Nana Vyavasay Mate Loan Yojana" is a component under the "Self-Employment Scheme" that provides financial assistance in the form of a loan to establish or expand small businesses such as grocery shops, medical stores, bookstores, etc.

fields.schemeName: Union Territory of Lakshadweep Pension Scheme for Widows
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide monthly financial assistance of ₹1,500/- to widows in the Union Territory of Lakshadweep. It covers widows who have not remarried and have no source of income.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Women and Child Development
fields.schemeName: Nari Adalat
fields.briefDescription: Nari Adalat, a component of the "Sambal" sub-scheme under Mission Shakti, it aims to provide women with an alternate Grievance Redressal Mechanism for resolving cases of petty nature (harassment, subversion, curtailment of rights or entitlements) faced by them at Gram panchayat level.

fields.schemeName: AICTE – Saksham Scholarship Scheme For Specially-Abled Student (Degree)
fields.briefDescription: Saksham is a Scholarship Scheme by the Ministry of Education, implemented by AICTE, aimed at providing encouragement and support to specially-abled children to pursue technical education. This is an attempt to give every young specially-abled student the opportunity to study further.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
fields.schemeName: Financial Support To The Students Of N.E.R For Higher Professional Courses (NEC Merit Scholarship)
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by the North Eastern Council (NEC), Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region for the students of the North Eastern States undergoing studies in different disciplines at different levels in Institutions inside as well as outside the North-East but within the country.

fields.schemeName: AICTE-Swanath Scholarship Scheme For Students
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by the Student Development Cell (StDC) of All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) to provide encouragement and support to orphans, wards of parents who died due to Covid-19, wards of Armed Forces, and Central Paramilitary Forces martyred in action (Shaheed).

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance For Procuring Mobility Equipment To Disabled Ex-Servicemen (All Ranks)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance of a maximum of ₹ 1,00,000 from the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund (AFFDF) for the procurement of modified scooters, crutches and wheelchairs for Ex-Servicemen who are disabled after their retirement from service with a disability of 50% or more.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Overseas Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment for regular, full-time students with disabilities to obtain higher education viz., Master's degree, or Ph.D. courses from foreign universities, in one of the specified fields of study.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: NDRI Institute Scholarship For M.Sc. And Ph.d
fields.briefDescription: “Institute Scholarship” is offered to all students of Indian Nationality admitted to Master’s and Doctoral programmes at NDRI to provide them with financial assistance.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: ICAR Emeritus Professor
fields.briefDescription: The ICAR floated the Scheme of Emeritus Professor in order to provide an opportunity to the superannuated teachers/ Scientists of universities, colleges and institutions under ICAR-AU System.

fields.schemeName: Central Assistance For One Time Settlement Of Displaced Families From PoK And Chhamb Under Prime Minister's Development Package
fields.briefDescription: A relief and rehabilitation scheme by the Ministry of Home Affairs provides central assistance to the displaced families from PoK And Chhamb and settled in the state of Jammu & Kashmir. The amount of Central Assistance of Rs. 5,49,692/- per family will be distributed through Direct Benefit Transfer.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: IASRI Scholarship For M.Sc And Ph.D
fields.briefDescription: The Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute is a premier Institute under the Indian Council of Agricultural Research for conducting research and education in the field of agricultural statistics and computer application in agriculture.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for Thrust Sectors: Scheme For Medical Equipment And Accessories, Medical Diagnostics And Ayush Products Manufacturing Units
fields.briefDescription: “Scheme For Medical Equipment And Accessories, Medical Diagnostics And Ayush Products Manufacturing Units'' under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)” for Thrust Sectors, by the Dept. of Industries, DNH & DD, aims to provide subsidy to Medical Equipment and AYUSH Products Manufacturing Units.

fields.schemeName: Creation of Modern Facilities in Market Committee: Scheme to provide assistance foe setting up modern facilities in Market Committee
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to Market Committees for setting up modern facilities, improving agricultural infrastructure, and enhancing the competitiveness of agricultural markets.

fields.schemeName: Mentally Retarded Children Benefit Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Mentally Retarded Children Benefit Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for the care of mentally retarded children (son/daughter) of construction workers.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Distribution of Female Menstrual Hygiene Kit for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Distribution of Female Menstrual Hygiene Kit for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides Menstrual Hygiene Kit to registered female beneficiaries.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Medical Assistance and Wage Loss for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Medical Assistance and Wage Loss for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, U.T. of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides medical expenses for injuries sustained during employment and will pay half-monthly wages during the period of disablement to the eligible worker.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Self Education for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Skill Development for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides reimbursement of the course fees for distance education from and an incentive for each degree.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Payment of Funeral Assistance for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Payment of Funeral Assistance for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for funeral expenses to the nominees/ dependents of a deceased registered member or their spouse.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Grant of Token Amount for Construction of House for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Grant of Token Amount for Construction of House for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance to the eligible registered member for construction of house.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Financial assistance for Marriage for the Construction Worker
fields.briefDescription: The "Financial Assistance for Marriage for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for marriage of self and for children (upto 2 children) of the building workers.

fields.schemeName: Economic Help To Sahariya Tribal Girl Students (Class 11 And 12)
fields.briefDescription: Rajasthan Government started a scholarship for Sahariya tribal girls' higher education (Class 11 and 12).

fields.schemeName: Hamaal Hetu Joota, Huk Evan Mahila Hamaal Hetu Soopa Aur Tokari Sahaayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started a scheme "Hamaal Hetu Joota, Huk Evan Mahila Hamaal Hetu Soopa Aur Tokari Sahaayata Yojana" for unorganized worker on 11 March 2015.

fields.schemeName: Vishesh Yogyajan Chhatravriti Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, scholarships and tuition fee reimbursement are provided to specially-abled students belonging to families with an annual income not exceeding ₹2.00 lakh, who are regularly studying in government and recognized educational institutions.

fields.schemeName: Kisan Parivahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to farmers for purchasing medium-sized goods vehicles to facilitate the transportation of agricultural produce.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister EBC Civil Seva Protsahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Bihar Government provides incentives to individuals belonging to the EBC Categories upon passing the preliminary examination of various competitive exams such as UPSC, BPSC, NDA, CDS, Banking, Railway, SSC, etc., to support their further preparation for the main examination/interview.

fields.schemeName: Promoting to Farmer for Post Harvesting & Management (Value Addition)
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to support farmers in setting up crop value addition units using post-harvesting technology and management concepts.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance On Marriage Of Children (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance on Marriage of Children (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Ashadeepa Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was introduced by the Government of Karnataka in the 2017-18 budget to encourage private sector industries and companies to provide employment opportunities to persons belonging to the Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe categories, ensuring social justice.

fields.schemeName: Incentive Assistance to Scheduled Caste Farmers to Increase the Area, Production and Productivity of Sugarcane Farming
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to SC farmers to increase sugarcane production and productivity through quality seeds, modern farming practices, and agricultural mechanization.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Maternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Digitization of Business Processes and Adoption of eCommerce
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers MSMEs up to 75% reimbursement (max ₹50,000) for software/equipment costs for digitization, plus 75% of e-commerce platform fees (excl. shipping), also up to ₹50,000. Reimbursement is allowed for one e-commerce platform per MSME only.

fields.schemeName: Samman Bhatta to War Widows and Parents of Martyrs
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide lifelong financial assistance of ₹5,000/- per month to war widows and parents of unmarried martyrs who sacrificed their lives in various wars, counter-insurgency operations, and aid to civil authorities before 31st March 1999.

fields.schemeName: Jan-Nayak Karpoori Thakur Kalyan Hostel Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Jan-Nayak Karpoori Thakur Kalyan Hostel Scheme" by the BC & EBC Welfare Department, Bihar provides hostel facilities for students near Saharsa District with food grains (9 kg rice, 6 kg wheat) and ₹1000/- per month as a grant.

fields.schemeName: Post Matric Scholarship for SC students (Delhi)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Post Matric Scholarship for SC Students" aims to support SC students financially for post-matriculation studies. Benefits include fee reimbursement and monthly allowances. Intended beneficiaries are SC students with a family income below ₹2,50,000/- annually.

fields.schemeName: World War II Pension
fields.briefDescription: The aim of the scheme is to provide lifelong financial assistance of ₹15,000/- per month as a measure of relief to World War II ex-servicemen and their widows who are not receiving any pension or financial assistance from any other source.

fields.schemeName: To Increase Fish Seed Production and Inland Fisheries Equipment in Non-Tribal Areas
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to enhance fish seed production and promote inland fisheries in non-tribal areas.

fields.schemeName: Fishermen Accident Relief Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Fishermen Accident Relief Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support the families of Gujarat's active fishermen by offering monetary compensation in case of accidental fatalities.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to enhance fish production and provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals engaged in inland fisheries.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Dr. Ambedkar Foundation Essay Competition Scheme for Class 10th-12th & Colleges/Universities/Institutions Students in 22 Indian Languages and English
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to encourage school, college & university students of 10th and 12th standards to write on the contribution of Babasaheb, particularly on his thoughts on social justice, empowerment of the depressed section, removal of caste-based discriminations, national integration, etc.

fields.schemeName: Intensive Castration Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Intensive Castration Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to control the stray animal population by castrating male calves and helps in reducing accidents caused by stray male animals in rural and urban areas.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Assistance to MSMEs for Market Development
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to MSMEs participating in national and international fairs/exhibitions/buyer-seller meets, etc., under the Rajasthan MSME Policy 2024.

fields.schemeName: Providing Navigational Aids and Other Infrastructure Facilities
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat. It aims to support fishermen by providing financial assistance for purchasing essential fishing equipment, life-saving gear, and infrastructure to enhance safety, efficiency, and fish preservation.

fields.schemeName: Scholarship/Merit Scholarship Schools SC/ST/OBC/Min (Studying in College/Technical/ Professional Institutions)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides monthly financial aid to SC/ST/OBC/Minority students pursuing higher education. Benefits include scholarships for hostellers and day scholars, with eligibility based on academic performance and income criteria.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to OBM Boat Owner Fishermen on Purchase of Kerosene
fields.briefDescription: The "Assistance to OBM Boat Owner Fishermen on Purchase of Kerosene" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to offer monetary aid to fishermen who use kerosene or petrol for their small boats operated by OBM.

fields.schemeName: Subsidy Scheme on Establishment of 25 R.I.R. Bird’s unit 40 R.I.R. Bird’s Unit and Stipend for Poultry Farming Training
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance and training to economically weaker sections and Divyang individuals in Gujarat for poultry farming.

fields.schemeName: Bhed Palan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote self-employment among marginalized communities through sustainable sheep rearing practices. Through this scheme, a sheep-rearing unit consisting of 10 female sheep and 1 male sheep (aged between 10 to 14 months) is provided to eligible beneficiaries.

fields.schemeName: Gau Palan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote cow rearing by providing financial support for the purchase of a milch cow. Through this scheme, a subsidy of ₹36,000 is given to SECC beneficiaries from SC/ST communities.

fields.schemeName: Mahila Bakri Palan
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of up to ₹35,000/- is provided by the State Government to eligible beneficiaries (Abandoned, widowed, destitute, single, and disaster-affected women) for the purchase of one unit of goats (comprising 3 females and 1 male), aged between 12 to 18 months.

fields.schemeName: Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (General Category)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (General Category)" provides 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed to General Category livestock owners after parturition to support cattle health, increase milk production, and enhance calf development.

fields.schemeName: Valmiki Chhatravritti Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Valmiki Chhatravritti Yojana" by the Department of Higher and Technical Education, Government of Jharkhand, aims to provide financial assistance and encouragement to orphaned and differently-abled students to pursue higher education and benefits include full tuition fee reimbursement.
